Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior: maeander band between dilute lines; below from left, presumably above handle area, large maeander, vertical dot-and-billet band and worn vertical broken maeander band; to right, large corner rosette and second rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The metopal decoration consisting of vertical dividing bands and large maeander pattern is typical of the Wild Goat Style. The presence of interior decoration and the shape of the heavy chalice, however, suggest that the vessel is late in that style and may represent the transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1526) (phase 2)
